title: Alice Simmons: The Melody of Justice
summary: Alice Simmons, a 32-year-old music conductor, discovers her ability to manipulate sound waves during a weeklong adventure, using her powers to combat crime and teach valuable lessons in her community.
summaryGerman: Alice Simmons, eine 32-jährige Dirigentin, entdeckt während eines einwöchigen Abenteuers ihre Fähigkeit, Schallwellen zu manipulieren, und nutzt ihre Kräfte, um Verbrechen zu bekämpfen und wertvolle Lektionen in ihrer Gemeinschaft zu vermitteln.
summaryDutch: Alice Simmons, een 32-jarige muziekdirigent, ontdekt haar vermogen om geluidsgolven te manipuleren tijdens een week lang avontuur, en gebruikt haar krachten om misdaad te bestrijden en waardevolle lessen te geven in haar gemeenschap.
summaryFrench: Alice Simmons, une cheffe d'orchestre de 32 ans, découvre sa capacité à manipuler les ondes sonores au cours d'une aventure d'une semaine, utilisant ses pouvoirs pour combattre le crime et enseigner des leçons précieuses dans sa communauté.

story.text: Alice discovers her sound manipulation abilities during a chaotic rehearsal when she unintentionally stops a falling stage light with a powerful note.
Inspired, Alice spends the day experimenting with her new powers, learning to control frequencies to create different effects.
Alice foils a robbery at a local bank using a disorienting sonic boom, feeling a mix of excitement and responsibility with her powers.
Faced with doubts, Alice reflects on her role and fears the danger it could bring to her students; she seeks counsel from a trusted mentor.
Rejuvenated by supportive words, Alice crafts a musical program to teach kids about courage and integrity, subtly integrating sound lessons.
Alice holds a concert in the park; unknown to the audience, she uses the event to subtly scan for and neutralize hidden threats, keeping her city safe.
At a local award ceremony, Alice is honored for her community service, not for her secret heroics but for her public contributions as a teacher.

ending: As the applause roared, Alice knew her strongest power was not in her hands, but in her heart.
moral: True heroism lies not just in great acts, but in the daily courage to make a positive difference.
